When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health area and the savings.

loans.use: to buy a sales cart.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a 26 years old, married, and has two sons. She has a small food market in her neighborhood. 

Ibtisam is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more food products and home detergents to increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase food products and home detergents.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 56 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends a university, majoring in business administration. Her husband is a truck driver. 

Sabah is requesting a loan to help her son pay for her son's next semester's fees. Her son took her place in the photo.

loans.use: to help her son pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en: Rasha is an 18-year-old single lady. She has seven siblings. Rashan has graduated from high school and registered at a university to study civil engineering. She has applied for this loan to pay for her semester's tuition.

loans.use: to pay for her college tuition.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: La Sra. Raquel tiene 38 años. Ella se dedica a decorar eventos y realiza trabajos de cotillón para la venta. Su esposo, Eusebio, trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transporte público. Doña Raquel se inició en este oficio desde hace más de doce años. Al principio solo realizaba trabajos en isopor para pequeños cumpleaños, con el tiempo pudo capacitarse y adquirir telas entre otras herramientas para decorar varios tipos de eventos, Actualmente también ofrece servicios de centros de mesa y otros accesorios para los eventos. Este crédito lo solicita para cumplir con un pedido de centros de mesa para un evento que le solicitan. Ellos tienen un hijo, quien está en edad escolar..
texts.en:
Raquel, 38, makes a living decorating events and making party supplies for sale.  Her husband, Eusebio, works as a driver for a public transportation company.  They have a school-age child.

Raquel began this job more than 12 years ago.  At first she only did work for small birthday parties.  In time she managed to train herself and acquire fabric and other tools to decorate various types of events.  Currently she also offers services for table centerpieces and other event accessories.

She's requesting this loan to fill an order for table centerpieces for an event.

loans.use: to fill an order for decorations

loans.name: Lkhavgaochir

texts.en:
Lkhagvaochir, 32 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. The family resides in their own traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. His son goes to high school. His wife has been running a knitting shop for three years. 

He has been running a taxi service for local people for four years and has a vast amount of experience in this type of service. Also during his free time, he makes and sells vacuum-insulated windows. The automobile he uses for his taxi service has deteriorated over the years and began consuming gas in large amounts, so he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas. As a result, he can continue to render his taxi service to his beloved customers, and a natural-gas-powered taxi will benefit the environment by emitting less smoke. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is one of the most reliable clients of our organization.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of eight. She has been running a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She does beautiful work for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to gain a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her household.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 10,000 to buy thread in different colors along with beads, sequins and stones. She hopes to increase in her income by getting more customers. She dreams of providing a quality education for her children, so they can have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy threads in different colors along with beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 47 years old, married, and has children. She has enjoyed the work of making Parandas for many years. Parandas are considered as a traditional hair accessory in Pakistan. Women use them for a traditional look on special occasions such as Eid (a holiday) and weddings. Zubaida makes beautiful Parandas, especially for bridal hairstyles. 

Zubaida initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Taking a loan from Kashf helped her account for expenses she thought she could not afford. Zubaida is requesting a loan for 25,000 PKR, which she will use to buy raw material including colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls for embellishment. This would help in attracting more customers. She desires to utilize her revenue on the well-being of her children. Zubaida is striving hard to meet her family's expenditures. She is responsible for providing them with good food, clothing, and education.

loans.use: to purchase raw material including colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls for embellishment.

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa, who just turned fifty years old, has five children. The oldest is 30 and the youngest is 14 years old. They all live in a little town in the northwestern part of their country.

For the past ten years, Shpresa has been buying and selling second-hand items. She states that because of this she has been able to feed all of her family members. Her oldest children do the same work; they are involved in this type of activity. They buy items from neighboring countries and sell them in the local market in the town where they reside.

Shpresa now needs a loan to buy more items to resell.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory of second-hand items to resell

loans.name: Soriya

texts.en:
Soriya is a 51-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a hand-embroidery business for the past five years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough alone to support his family well. Soriya’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning member of her household. 

She is a loving mother of six children and is responsible for providing with good quality food, clothes and education. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for the girls of her village. She would like to teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and also to earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing demand.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 51 years old, widowed, and has five children. She has been weaving sweaters for almost 15 years. She works hard on her weaver every day so she may earn a living for her family and provide food, health, and education. 

Farida is requesting her fourth loan from Kashf Foundation for. 30,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors. With the loan, she hopes to increase her sales.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been making shoes for many years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong, but business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

To meet customers’ demand consistently she has requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to purchase good quality leather, plastic leather, and the spools of threads and laces to increase sales. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of her earnings on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase good quality leather, plastic leather, and spools of threads and laces for shoemaking.

loans.name: Sajeda

texts.en: Sajeda is a 19-year-old single lady. She has a sister and a brother. She has managed to get a good degree and has registered in a government university, which is cheaper than a private one, trying to save money. She is now a freshman majoring in physics and has applied for this loan to help her in paying the semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay her college tuition for the semester.

loans.name: Gazala

texts.en:
Gazala is a 39-year-old, married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community.

Gazala requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es: José de 33 años de edad  habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años.  José cultiva los principales granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles y maíz. Cada año repite esta actividad ya que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida. Es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora. Trabaja muy duro para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos  diferente a la agricultura. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar es préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra del abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y semillas. Con mucha confianza en Dios y en su trabajo espera tener una cosecha abundante de la cual pueda vender una parte y dejar otra parte para el consumo. Espera cumplir su sueño de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: José is 33 years old and lives in the house on his property together with his life companion and their children. He has made a living from agriculture for many years. José cultivates the primary basic grains like: rice, beans and corn. He repeats this activity each year as it’s the only way he knows how to make a living. He is a very hard-working, responsible and entrepreneurial person. He works very hard to bring the daily bread home, as he doesn’t have any source of income other than agriculture. Because of this he has made the decision to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of fertilizers, pesticides and seeds. With much trust in God and in his work he hopes to have an abundant crop so he can sell one part and leave the other part for consumption. He hopes to fulfill his dream of giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fertilizers, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 36 years old, married, and has four children.  She works from home as a tailor, which she has been doing  for two years. She is proud to be contributing to her household income. Most of her clients are her neighbors. She earns enough through this business to meet the needs of her family members. 

Shamim is requesting a loan for 20,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a stock of threads, packs of needles, laces, and zippers in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of threads, packs of needles, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is 36 years old, married, and has four children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family. Two years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for her neighbors and uses the income to support her entire family.
 
Due to lack of availability of funds, Noor is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan from Kashf Foundation for 20,000 PKR, which she will use to buy raw material including spools of threads, packs of buttons, laces, and zippers in various colors to create a means of increasing her revenue.

loans.use: to purchase raw material including spools of threads, packs of buttons, laces, and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Tilateñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ TILATEÑAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de escobas, tienda de pulpería, venta de carne, ayudante de albañil, tejido a macramé, venta de coca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de transporte público; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años, por enseñanza de su padre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra llantas) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo adecuará a en su movilidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “TILATEÑAS” communal association will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Villa Adela. It is formed by nine members and has a board of directors, of which Julia is the President. The members of the communal association have various businesses, including: the sale of brooms, a small grocery store, the sale of meat, working as the assistant to a stonemason, macrame weaving, and the sale of coca.

The loan they will take out will benefit small business owners, of which Julia is a member. She indicates that it is the second cycle they are part of at Pro Mujer, joining in by invitation from a promoter at the institution who came to visit her at home. She currently has a public transportation business; she says that she started this business two years ago, having been taught by her father.

The loan that she will take out now is for the increase in capital (buying tires) that she will acquire from the distributor stores in the city of El Alto and will subsequently put on her car. This means of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as well as possible, as she is married and has two children.

When you consult her on what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the meetings and saving money.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Pahnan

texts.en:
Pahnan is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She has been in the business of milk sales for many years. She has three calves, two cows, and one buffalo in milk. She used to purchase small calves and sell them at the festival of Eid-ul-Azha. Gradually she purchased cows and buffaloes to start her business of selling milk.  Pahnan sells milk, butter, cheese, and ghee to her neighbors. She has a good client list. 

Pahnan is requesting her sixth loan from Kashf Foundation for 30,000 PKR, which she will use to buy one more cow in order to increase her milk production and be able to serve more people in her community. She wishes to utilize part of her revenue on the marriages of her daughters.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  Los Ángeles está conformado por 10 integrantes, 9 mujeres, y un hombre, madres y padres, responsables con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Malpaisillo se caracteriza por sus trabajos artesanales, bebidas típicas como el tiste o pinolillo. Estos integrantes del banco se caracterizan por ser personas, trabajadoras, responsables, luchadoras en la vida han tenido que trabajar desde temprana edad, por falta de recursos económicos, ninguna pudo estudiar.
Gracias a su capacidad de emprendimiento y ganas de superación, Frania del socorro es la coordinadora del banco y  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda donde se vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: caja de fosforo, sobre de café, cigarro menudeados, arroz, frijoles, sal, pan, huevos, tiste, chicha, jugos. Gaseosas, tortillas. La rutina diaria de Frania es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestible para su pulpería. Y en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Los Ángeles agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Los Ángeles communal bank is formed by 10 members, 9 women and one man, mothers and fathers responsible for 20 children. They are from Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the western area of the country. Malpaisillo is known for artisanal work and typical beverages like tiste or pinolillo. These members of the bank are hard-working and responsible people who strive to make a living. They have had to work from a young age; due to a lack of economic resources, none of them were able to study.

Thanks to her capacity for entrepreneurship and desire to overcome, Frania del Socorro is the coordinator of the bank and has a small grocery business located in her home. A “pulpería” is a small store where grocery products are sold in small quantities like: matchboxes, coffee packets, cigarettes, rice, beans, salt, bread, eggs, tiste, chicha, juices, sodas, and tortillas. Frania’s daily routine is to work about 10 hours a day offering her products. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business in the buying and selling of grocery products for her small store, and to earn a better income in the not-so-distant future. The Los Ángeles communal bank thanks the Kiva investors for the help they provide to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her small grocery store with products like matchboxes, coffee packets, cigarettes, rice, beans, salt, bread, eggs, tiste, chicha, juices, sodas, and tortillas.

loans.name: Ekhad Group

texts.en:
Ekhad Group is composed of five members. These members are tribal women residing in D. Phailien village, which is about 67 kilometers from Imphal, the capital of Manipur. Manipur is a state that lies in the northeastern part of India. Each group member has an important role in running her respective family. By coming together in a group, they are able to support each other and share their experiences. This togetherness has paved a way for them to sustain themselves.

Moinu is the profile member, and is seen in the picture with her hand raised. She is a 38-year-old mother. She has five sons, all of whom are school-going. Her husband is a carpenter by profession and works in a carpentry workshop. With her husband’s wage, they can hardly manage their childrens' school fees and all the requirements at home. Therefore, she took up the job of selling vegetables, hoping that she can bring home some money to manage at least two square meals for the family.

Though she is a vegetable vendor, she does not own a shop. She carries her stock in a conical bamboo basket, which is a local handmade basket used by tribal people in northeast India. She goes from door to door in the locality and sometimes even to far places carrying and selling vegetables. These vegetables include mustard leaf, peas, tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, cauliflower, brinjal (eggplant), bean leaves, bamboo shoots, and cucumbers, as well as fruits like lemons. Keeping aside the capital, whatever profit she makes is spent for buying rice for the family and some portion is kept for repayment of the loan. With her next loan, she plans to buy more varieties of vegetables and fruits so that she can make more profit.

In the same way, the other members of the group engage themselves in activities like raising pigs or selling vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to buy varieties of vegetables and fruits to sell for profit.

loans.name: Erdene-Oyun

texts.en:
Erdene-oyun is 33 years old and has one child who attends school.  She lives with her child and parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her parents retired from work and receive a pension from the state. 

Erdene-oyun has been running her furniture sales business since 2008 and accumulated a vast amount of experience. The furniture she sells is imported from China and she has a reliable supplier. During the national white moon festival, the demand for new furniture rises drastically and this time of year is her business's high point. 

Erdene-oyun is requesting a loan for 4,000,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase sofas, chairs, tables, and drawers in large amounts. As a result, she can run her business without worrying about an inventory shortage. She is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase sofas, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Wesam

texts.en: Wesam is a 27 year-old single lady who has looked after her younger 4 siblings since their father passed away. She was able to establish a small learning center where they give English conversational courses and Tofel courses. Wesam has applied to this youth loan to buy some needed equipment to enhance the learning process and improve the learning center, in hopes that she can add more designing courses in the future and start giving certificates to its students.

loans.use: buy needed equipment to enhance her learning center

loans.name: Hadbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Hadbaatar, 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. His 8-year-old son goes to school, and his younger son, 4 years old, stays at home with his mother. In August 2011 he began working at a mining business. For the upcoming national holiday known as White Moon, he wants to update all of his house's old furniture by purchasing new furniture. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a chest of drawers, a chair, a table, a recliner, etc. With his house decorated with new furniture, he can greet the White Moon with joy and happiness. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms Bushra is a 32 year-old active, married woman. She is effectively running an embroidery business with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Bushra’s husband. She has five years of experience in this field. Her collection is very famous in her town and she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to lead a decent life.

She is a loving mother of one child and is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she requested for a loan of Rs.10,000 to purchase a stock of threads with the packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in various colors. She expects more profits and hence can better support her family members. She desires to spend the part of income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of threads with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en: Using the previous loan has helped Thaer to register for the semester and he successfully passed it. Now, Thaer is applying for another educational loan to continue with his studies and pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene  68  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y un nieto actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones junto con la ayuda del nieto en una pequeña propiedad que tienen y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra de insumos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que ella solicita un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Claudia is 68 years old, married and lives with her husband and a grandson now. She intends to buy materials such as fertilizers and fumigants with this loan, as well as help with the labor. She plans to maintain these plantations, along with the help of grandson, on this small property. Along with her coffee making project, it will help her to generate more income to contribute to her family.  She does not have the money to purchase these raw materials, and due to her lack of resources, she doesn't have a method to earn such necessary funds.  This is why she requested a loan. It is the first loan she received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans from state banks before but FUDECOSUR provided the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate ......

loans.use: to buy raw materials

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Raafat

texts.en: Raafat is a 22 years old single guy. He is the youngest brother of three sisters. Raafat is a university student majoring in accounting. He is applying for this educational loan to be able to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees for next semester

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 44 years old conservative housewife. Her daughter has taken her place in the photo.
Sahar started helping her husband in supporting their three daughters and a son when she opened a home based children daycare. Now their oldest daughter Hala is a 20 years old university student majoring in business administration. She has applied to this loan to help her daughter pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to help her daughter pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 41 year-old conservative housewife - her husband appears in the photo instead. 
One of their children is Aya, a 19 years old single lady. Aya successfully enrolled in the university to study e-business administration. Her father opened a small café to be able to support his family as his retirement salary is not enough. With the help of her father, Elham also wants to contribute and help her daughter by applying to this educational loan to be able to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Nibal

texts.en:
Nibal is a 47-year-old, conservative woman. She asked her son, Musa, to appear in the photo, instead. 

Besides Musa, Nibal has another four children. Now, Musa is a university student his mother wants to support by paying for his semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 38-year-old, single woman. She is living with her parents and is helping to add another source of income to the family by forming her business of selling clothes. 

She began by buying clothes in a large quantity and starting a distribution business to sell clothes to other clothing stores in the area. Now, she has expanded the business and has started selling on her own, in addition to the clothing distribution business. 

Amani is applying for this loan to improve her new line of business by making good shelves and buying some shower hangers to hang the clothes on until she opens her own clothing store.

loans.use: to build shelves and buy shower hangers to hang clothes for sale.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Abeer is a 35-year-old single lady. She works in a private company. She has four younger unmarried siblings. One of them is a university student who works to pay for his university fees. Abeer wants to help her brother as his final paycheck was not enough for the fees for the upcoming semester and so she has applied for an educational loan.

loans.use: to help her brother pay for his educational fees.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is a 38 year-old married woman. She is also a mother of 2 boys and 2 girls. While her husband works as a governmental driver, Ibtisam started selling blankets and bed covers. She also used to sell baby clothes but she has sold all of it and wants to buy more to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more baby clothes for sale

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia de 42 años convive con su esposo Eusebio, con quien  tiene 3 hijos a los que quiere y cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en un distrito agrícola.
El trabajo que Celia realiza requiere de entrega y constancia. Lleva más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura, actividad que le ha dado mucha satisfacción.  Sus principales cultivos constan de arveja, papa y maíz; los cuales comercializa a un buen precio en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde viaja después de cada cosecha. “se invierte bastante dinero en la agricultura, pero al momento de cosechar recuperamos y ganamos”, dice. Gracias a su trabajo pudo obtener los 5 terrenos cultivables que ahora posee.
Una de las ventajas es contar con animales como toros, los que emplea para arar la tierra. Muchas veces alquila sus animales a otros agricultores, ganando como 90 soles al día. 
Celia está preparada para la siembra de estos meses, ya que la temporada de grandes siembras llegó y ella no se quedará atrás y cultivará papas y arvejas. Ella y su esposo están emocionados, porque de ésta temporada depende la mayor parte de sus ingresos del año. Solicita de su apoyo. Éste es su crédito número 12 con MFP. Está agradecida por el apoyo brindado. Pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay”, donde sus socios son puntuales y colaboradores.
Con los 3000 soles solicitados podrá adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes, semillas de arvejas y papas; así también podrá pagar los servicios de los peones que contratará.
texts.en:
Celia, forty-two, lives with her husband, Eusebio, with whom she has three children that she loves and cares for in her own house, located in an agricultural district.  Her work requires perseverance and dedication.  For more than twenty years she's been in agriculture and it has provided her a lot of satisfaction.  Her main crops are peas, potatoes, and corn, which she sells for a nice price at the city wholesale market, where she travels after every harvest.  "We invest a lot of money in the crops, but as soon as we harvest them we recoup costs and make a profit," she says. Thanks to her work, Celia was able to buy the five plots of cultivable land she now has.

One of the advantages Celiea has is animals, like oxen, that she uses to till the land.  A lot of times she'll lease her animals out to other farmers, bringing in around 90 soles per day.

Celia is prepared for the coming months of planting; the big planting season has come and she's going to plant potatoes and peas and not get left behind.  She and her husband are excited because the bulk of their annual income depends on this time of year.  Celia is seeking your support.  This will be her twelfth  loan with MFP, and she grateful for the support.  She belongs to the "Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay" [Beautiful Cumutay Dawn] Communal Bank, whose members are punctual and collaborative.

With the loan of 3000 soles Celia will be able to buy bags of fertilizer, pea and potato seed, as well as pay for any laborers she might hire.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers and pea and potato seed, and to be able to pay any laborers she might hire.

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en:
Goreth is a single mother, 40 years old. She is engaged in agriculture, particularly growing passion fruits. 

She applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (two million shillings) to improve her passion fruit garden by buying pesticides and paying her laborers. 

Goreth has four children and all of them go to school. Apart from growing passion fruits, Goreth also grows tomatoes. She works six days a week and  most of her customers come from Kampala, where the demand for passion fruit is high. Also, local people, schools, and hospitals are her daily customers. Goreth has been doing this for the last two years and has been able to take care of and educate her siblings. 

With this loan, Goreth hopes she will be able to improve upon the quantity and quality of passion fruits produced. This will, in turn, help her to raise money to pay back the loan and, later, buy more land, so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to improve her passion fruit garden by buying pesticides and paying her laborers.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en: Enock lives with his wife and 4 children in Katebe village in Lyantonde. He has been a borrower for the last two years. His previous loan was 1,000,000 UGX. He would now wish to borrow 2,000,000 UGX. He buys calves and tenders them for 3 months and thereafter sells them. He wants to buy more calves and to get to a level where he no longer borrows. His biggest challenge is lack of sufficient funds for his cattle business.

loans.use: To buy more cows

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, alegre, muy amable y con muchas ganas de progresar. Convive junto a su pareja. Es madre de 3 hijos: Anthony de 19 años, Jesi de 14 años y Rosita de 10 años de edad, a quienes quiere mucho y son su motivación para continuar trabajando. Están instalados cómodamente en su propia casa la cual compró con  mucho esfuerzo..
La actividad que realiza Rosa es la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, aceite entre otros. Todos estos productos los envía a los caseríos ubicados en las riberas de los ríos y zonas alejadas de la ciudad, donde vive su  hermano. Él recibe toda la mercadería y lo vende a los pobladores del lugar. Paralelo a este trabajo,también dedica en la venta de comidas por las noches en el frontis de su casa. De esa manera logra completar capital suficiente para pagar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. 
Rosa se inició hace más de 2 años, pero recuerda que anteriormente no le alcanzaban para solventar las necesidades de sus hijos. Ahora viendo los buenos resultados que está obteniendo, tiene planes de continuar aumentado el volumen de sus compras.
Este es el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por tanto agradece el acceso al financiamiento que le brindan para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además, se siente cómoda trabajando con los integrantes de su banco comunal pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
  
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería variada como arroz, azúcar, comestibles, combustible y otros para enviar a su hermano y venda los productos a la gente que vive en los caserios ribereños.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old. She is an enterprising, cheerful and very friendly woman, with a great desire to get ahead in life. She lives with her partner, and is the mother of three children: Anthony, 19; Jesi, 14; and Rosita, 10, whom she loves very much and who are her motivation for continuing to work. 

They are comfortably settled in their own home, which they bought with a great deal of effort. Rosa's business is selling groceries such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and other items. All these products she sends to settlements located on the banks of the rivers and to areas far from the city, where her brother lives. He receives all the merchandise and sells it to the local inhabitants. 

Along with this work, she also sells meals in the evenings in front of her home. This way she manages to raise enough capital to pay her household's expenses and her children's education. Rosa began more than two years ago, but remembers that before, her earnings were not enough to pay for her children's needs. Now, seeing the good results she is getting, she plans to continue increasing the volume of her purchases. 

This is her third loan with the MFP institution. Therefore she is grateful for the access to financing that they offer, enabling her to meet her objectives. In addition, she feels comfortable working with the members of her communal bank, as she considers them responsible and supportive people. 

With the amount applied for of 1500 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of a variety of merchandise, such as rice, sugar, groceries, fuel and other items to send to her brother, so that he can sell products to people who live in the settlements along the river.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, groceries, fuel and other items.

loans.name: Adisa

texts.en: Adisa has been selling tomatoes, onions, garden eggs, oil and other food items for 15 years now.  A single mother of three, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. Adisa will use her loan to purchase more vegetables to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gaba Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Gaba group, small businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to request a loan of 500,000 Leones for each in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses by purchasing more inventories to add to their current ones.

Matilda, the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs, is 37 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is attending secondary school, while the other is not of school-going age. Matilda sells palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste) and clothes. Matilda is going to use her share of this loan to buy more palm oil, margi and clothing in bulk to add to her business.

(Also included on the right in the photo is loan officer Sarah, posing with the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi and clothes in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino de 50 años, está casado con Dominga con quien tiene 2 hijos que ya son jóvenes. Ellos viven en su casa propia que Celestino construyó con esfuerzo y se ubica en un distrito rural
A su edad se considera un hombre experto y dinámico;  se dedica a la agricultura desde los 18 años.  En la actualidad siembra papa, arvejas, maíz y flores de gladiolos en sus terrenos de cultivos. Le gusta mucho la labor de campo porque la realizan todos los miembros de su familia, aunque reconoce que la labor es sacrificada ya que debe vigilar todos sus cultivos, para que no se pierdan por las plagas o los factores climáticos adversos, de esta manera siente que su dedicación es recompensada durante el tiempo de cosecha, pues recoge toda su producción y la vende en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad a regulares precios. 
Así también se dedica a la crianza de abejas, que también considera como un pasatiempo. Y obtiene ingresos extras por la venta de la miel.
Las temporadas de siembras de papas, arvejas, y maíz llegaron. Necesita de su apoyo para continuar con sus metas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este sería su crédito número 12 con MFP, está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito.
Él invertirá los 2000 soles en la compra de 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas y otras de fertilizantes orgánicos.
texts.en:
Celestino is 50 years old, and married to Dominga, with whom he has two children, who are already young adults. They live in their own house that Celestino constructed with effort, located in a rural district. 

At his age he is considered an expert and dynamic man; he has been farming since he was 18. Currently he grows potatoes, peas, corn and gladiolus flowers on his farmland. He likes farmwork because all the members of his family carry out the work, though he recognizes that it is demanding, as he must watch over all his crops so that they are not lost because of pests or adverse weather conditions. 

This way he feels his dedication is rewarded during harvest time, as he harvests all his production and sells it at the wholesale market in the city, at stable prices. 

He also raises bees which he also considers a hobby. He obtains extra income through the sale of honey. The seasons for planting potatoes, peas and corn have arrived, and he needs your support to continue toward his goals. He belongs to the "Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay" communal bank, and this will be his 12th loan with MFP. 

He is very grateful to all all the people who have made the loan possible. He will use the 2000 soles to purchase three bags of pea seeds, and others of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy three bags of pea seeds and others of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua, who is married and has six dependents, has been selling smoked fish for 30 years now. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them for sale. Efua uses her income to support her husband in the feeding and clothing of their children.

Efua will use her loan to purchase fresh fish in large quantities to smoke for sale. She will expand her business with the resulting new profits.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish in large quantities to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is single and has one child. 

She is a petty trader who sells vegetables (e.g. tomatoes, onions, garden eggs), oil, and other food items.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  Adwoa uses her income to feed and clothe her child as well as pay for her child's school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase more vegetables to sell.  With the additional profit, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia Andrea

texts.es:
Cecilia Orellana vende ropa para niños y adultos, trabaja desde su casa en la comuna de La Pintana, donde reside. Se dedica a este negocio hace dos años, trabajando de lunes a domingo, promedio 8 hrs diarias. Su manera de vender es dinámica, ofrece sus productos puerta a puerta, improvisa un puesto en su propio jardín (“venta de jardín”), visita otros sectores de familiares donde se da conocer y así aumentar su clientela. 
Compra su mercadería en el barrio Patronato, muy conocido por la venta de vestuarios por mayor y menor a precios de bajo costo.
Usa su crédito para abastecerse de mercadería, su sueño es ver ampliado su negocio y tener un local propio.
Lo que le motiva a Cecilia en continuar su negocio es tener un ingreso extra para su casa, vive con su marido y dos hijos, ambos estudian en la Básica y Media, apoyando ella económicamente a su familia, lograrán cumplir sus aspiraciones.
Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es que ha recibido buena capacitación que le ha permitido entender  el manejo de su negocio.  
La Pintana es una comuna ubicada al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile), en la región Metropolitana. Se caracteriza por ser una comuna con altos índices de pobreza, donde más de un 10 por ciento de los habitantes vive en situación de indigencia. Por lo anterior, la autoridad local (municipalidad) se ha preocupado de desarrollar variados programas sociales enfocados a aportar al  mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de sus habitantes.
texts.en:
Cecilia Orellana sells clothing for children and adults. She works from her home in the La Pintana community, where she lives. She has worked in this business for two years, working an average of eight hours a day Monday to Sunday. She has a very dynamic way of selling. She offers her products door to door, improvises a kiosk in her own yard (yard sale), and she visits other places where family members live so that she can make herself known, and that way she expands her clientele. She buys her merchandise in the Patronato neighborhood, which is well-known for selling low-priced clothing wholesale and retail. She is using her loan to stock up on merchandise. Her dream is to see her business expand and have her own store. 

Having an extra income for her household is what motivates Cecilia to continue her business. She lives with her husband and two children. They study in primary and secondary school. With Cecilia supporting the family economically, they will achieve their dreams. What she likes most about working with Fondo Esperanza is that she has received good training that has allowed her to understand the management of her business. 

La Pintana is a community located to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile), in the Metropolitan region. It is characterized by its high levels of poverty, where more than 10% of the inhabitants live in extreme poverty. Consequently, the local authorities (municipality) have concerned themselves with developing several social programs focused on improving the lives of its inhabitants.

loans.use: to buy new styles of clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
María Soledad Gacitúa vende ropa usada hace mas de 20 años, su lugar de venta es en la feria de su barrio, en la comuna de La Pintana, se instala de martes a viernes mediodía. Compra su mercadería a mayoristas, quienes le venden por fardos, la cual le conviene por bajo precio y gran surtido.
Nos comenta que usó su crédito para comprar un toldo, colgadores y fardos de ropa.
A futuro tiene como meta exponer su mercadería en ferias más grandes y en Ferias Navideñas.
A María Soledad lo que más le motiva en continuar con su negocio es que es independiente económicamente, en lo personal, siguiendo el consejo de su médico, le sirve de distracción y se siente útil.
Nos comenta que vive con su pareja solamente, ya que sus hijos formaron su propio hogar, ha formado una gran familia, tiene 13 nietos y uno por nacer.
Con entusiasmo nos cuenta que le gusta asistir a las charlas y reuniones que realiza Fondo Esperanza, pues ha aprendido a administrar su negocio y por otra parte ha hecho amistades y lo pasa muy bien.
La Pintana es una comuna ubicada al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile), en la región Metropolitana. Se caracteriza por ser una comuna con altos índices de pobreza, donde más de un 10 por ciento de los habitantes vive en situación de indigencia. Por lo anterior, la autoridad local (municipalidad) se ha preocupado de desarrollar variados programas sociales enfocados a aportar al  mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de sus habitantes.
texts.en:
María Soledad Gacitúa has sold used clothing for more than 20 years. She sells at a market in her neighborhood, in the La Pintana community. She works here from Tuesday to Friday. She buys her merchandise from wholesalers, who sell by the bundle, which is good for her because of the low cost and the wide selection. She tells us that she used her loan to purchase an awning, clothes hangers, and bundles of clothing. Her goal for the future is to show her merchandise in bigger markets and Christmas fairs. What motivates María Soledad the most to continue with her business is the fact that she is economically independent. Personally, following the advice of her doctor, it gives her something to do and she feels useful. She tells us that she only lives with her spouse, since her children moved into their own homes. She has a large family - 13 grandchildren and one on the way. She enthusiastically tells us that she likes to go to the chats and meetings that Fondo Esperanza puts together. She has learned to manage her business, and she has also made friends and she enjoys it.

La Pintana is a community located to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile), in the Metropolitan region. It is characterized by its high levels of poverty, where more than 10% of the inhabitants live in extreme poverty. Consequently, the local authorities (municipality) have concerned themselves with developing several social programs focused on improving the lives of its inhabitants.

loans.use: to buy an awning, clothes hangers, and bundles of used clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alesasandro

texts.es:
Alessandro, de 29 años de edad, es un hombre  trabajador  y empeñoso, con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Es soltero sin hijos.  Vive en compañía de sus padres y sus 3 hermanos a quienes quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente la casa de sus padres.
La actividad que realiza  Alessandro  es la venta de comidas típicas de región por las noches como “juanes” que es arroz envuelto en hoja, pollos fritos, arroz chaufa y otros, para eso se instala todos los días en el frontis de su casa, donde pone sus mesitas y sillas para atender muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y transeúntes.  
Lleva realizando ésta actividad desde hace 04 años,  también hace la venta de “parrilladas de pollos” y “ceviches” los fines de semana, lográndose hacerse conocido y solicitado por su buena sazón,  atendiendo con la ayuda de madre y un ayudante ocasionalmente.
Además cuenta con un empleo de medio tiempo por las mañanas en una empresa encuestadora, contando de esa manera con varios ingresos económicos.
Considera rentable  su negocio pues le permite contar con un ingreso económico para apoyarse y apoyar con los gastos de su hogar, además de contar con una buena demanda de sus comidas ha logrado ver sus ganancias a diario, logrando ahorrarse un capital.  Por tanto, tiene planeado ampliar su negocio y seguir con la venta de comida.
Este es el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP. Por tanto cuenta de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y responsable.
Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, azuzar aceites y utensilios como platos, vasos y demás,  buscando menores precios por sus compras al contado.
texts.en:
Alessandro, age 29, is a hard-working and diligent man with a great desire to get ahead.  He is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents and his three siblings, whom he loves very much.  He lives very comfortably in his parents’ house.

Alessandro’s business activity is selling food that is typical of the region.  He sells at night, and he sells things like “juanes”, which is rice wrapped in a  leaf, fried chicken, stir fried rice, and others.  In order to do so, he sets up in front of his house every day.  He puts out tables and chairs in order to very kindly tend to his customers, who are mostly neighbors and people who are passing by.

He has been doing this business activity for four years.  He also sells grilled chicken and ceviche on the week-ends.  He has managed to become well-known for doing so, and is sought out for his good seasoning.  At times his mother and an assistant help him.  He also has a part time job in the mornings working for a polling company.  This way he has a number of incomes.

He thinks that his business is profitable.  It allows him to have an income to support himself and to help with the household expenses.  Also, in addition to having a good demand for his food, he has managed to see daily income and to save money.  Therefore, he plans to expand his business and to continue selling food.

This is his fourth loan with MFP.  He is counting on a small loan in order to be able to meet his objectives.  In addition to feeling comfortable with his communal bank, he considers it to be a cohesive and responsible group.

He will use the requested 500 soles to buy ingredients to prepare his food.  He will buy things like rice, sugar, cooking oil, and utensils like plates, cups, and the rest.  He will be looking for lower prices by purchasing for cash.

loans.use: to buy things like rice, sugar, cooking oil, and utensils like plates, cups, and the rest.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 47 años, es una mujer buena, amable y trabajadora, convive con su pareja en la casa de su suegra y juntos comparte el mismo deseo por salir adelante.
El trabajo de Yolanda consiste en la venta de gaseosas y helados. Todos los lunes realiza su pedido a un local de distribución con el cual trabaja, sienndos estos llevados a su domicilio y donde procede a colocarlas en la congeladora para que puedan estar listas para el consumo de sus clientes. Además de vender gaseosas también vende hielo y helados de frutas que ella mismo prepara. Trabaja en ésta actividad por más de 4 años con la ayuda de su suegra, quien la reemplaza cuando se encuentra trabajando como enfermera en un nosocomio particular de la ciudad.
Aun recuerda el primer día que se puso a vender bebidas y todos los temores y dudas que tenía, pero poco a poco fue consolidándose y aprendiendo el negocio, ahora es una gran vendedora y tiene muchos clientes, tiene muchos planes de consolidar una distribuidora de bebidas, pero por el momento solo quiere incrementar su negocio y que sea reconocido.
Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en  los créditos anteriores que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500), comprará mayor cantidad de gaseosas y helados, además comprará ingredientes y mas insumos para seguir preparando helados de frutas regionales.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 47, is a good, friendly, and hardworking woman.  She lives with her partner in her mother-in-law's house and together they share a desire to get ahead.

Yolanda's job is selling soda and ice cream.  Every Monday she receives her orders at a distribution center with which she works.  She takes them home and puts them in the freezer so they'll be ready for her customers to eat.

In addition to selling soda she also sells ice and fruit ice cream that she makes herself.  She has done this job for more than four years with the help of her mother-in-law, who substitutes for her when she's working as a nurse in a private hospital in the city.

She still remembers the first day she began selling beverages, and all her fears and doubts.  Little by little, though, she started establishing herself and learning the business.  Now she's a great saleswoman and she has a lot of customers.  She has a lot of plans to become a beverage distributor, but for now she only wants to increase her business and to be recognized.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She's grateful to those who make her loan possible to continue with her goals.  She's also committed to making her payments punctually as she did with her previous loans.  She's very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very good, friendly, and supportive.

With the requested amount (1500 soles [PEN]) she'll buy a large quantity of soda and ice cream, as well as the ingredients and other supplies to continue making ice cream with regional fruits.

loans.use: to buy soda, ice cream, and ingredients to make ice cream with regional fruits

loans.name: Yunusu

texts.en:
Yunusu is a repeat client in his second loan cycle. He is 39 years old and has a wife and three children, two of whom go to school. 

He applied for a loan of two million shillings to improve his passion fruit nursery and tomato garden. Yunusu has been engaged in this business for the last three years. He is also heavily involved in banana and coffee growing, which is his main source of income. Apart from these activities, he also has a small retail shop. 

Yunusu works seven days a week and he mainly sells his produce in the local trading centre, markets and schools within the region.

As a farmer who depends on the mercy of the climate and weather, he faces challenges from drought, pests and disease, low prices and limited capital. 

However, Yunusu has a positive attitude and all this compels him to work harder and he hopes to be a very successful farmer very soon.

loans.use: to develop his passion fruit nursery and tomato garden.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y  cordial. Está casada con Cesar quien es contador de profesión, fruto de esa unión tienen 02 hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad a los que quiere mucho, habitando en su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Lola es el cultivo de palma aceitera, para eso cuenta con un terreno de 10 hectáreas en las cuales tiene sembrado  palma aceitera la cual está en producción, ya que lleva en el negocio poca más de 04 años, y ahora se dedica a la cosecha y venta de su producción, contando con el apoyo de su pareja en el administración de su negocio.
Considera rentable su negocio por ser de constante producción y tener bastante demanda, dejándole buenas ganancias, así logra solventar sus gastos. Le gsuta lo que hace ya se siente una mujer empresaria, y por tanto tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir. Este es el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se siente a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera que son buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abono, herbicida para el mantenimiento de sus siembras de palma aceitera.
texts.en:
Lola, forty-nine, is a hardworking and diligent, as well as friendly and cordial, woman.  She's married to Cesar, an accountant.  They have two children, eighteen and sixteen, whom she loves very much and they all live in her own house.  

Lola grows oil palm trees. She has a ten hectare plot of productive trees.  She's been in business for a little over four years and now makes her living harvesting and selling her product while her husband helps administer the business. 

Lola feels that continuous production and sufficient demand make the business profitable, and she earns a good income and manages to pay her expenses.  She likes what she does and sees herself as a businesswoman, so she has a great desire to succeed.  This will be her third loan with MFP and she's hoping for your collaboration so she can continue on with her goals.  She is pleased with her communal bank and thinks they're good people.  With the 1500 soles loan she's requesting she'll invest in fertilizer and herbicide to take care of her oil palm trees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide to care for her oil palm crop.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married and has six dependents.  

She is a fishmonger who sells smoked fish.  She has been in this business for ten years.  She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them.  

Her income is used to support her family, in particular to feed and clothe her children.  Angelina will use the loan to purchase fresh fish in large quantities to smoke.  She plans to use the additional profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is 43 years old, married, with three children. Two of his children work and the other is still studying. He lives in a mountainous area. His main source of income is from farming.

Ernesto's wife is a Barangay Health Worker and owns a retail store. The couple both work hard because they want to have a better way of life and a stable source of income.

Currently, Ernesto grows corn on his one hectare of land and raises two sows. He has been running his livestock business for one year.

Ernesto wants to feed his pigs with quality feed but due to shortage of capital he is seeking a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos, which will allow him to buy supplies such as feed, vitamins and vaccines for his livestock.

Ernesto hopes to use the loan to generate more income, which will be used to expand his livestock business and to send his youngest child into higher education.

loans.use: to buy livestock supplies such as feed, vitamins and vaccine.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married with six dependents and is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market, smokes them and sells them. 

Aba has been selling smoked fish for 10 years. She uses her income to support her husband and to feed and clothe their children. 

Aba will use her loan to purchase fresh fish in large quantities to smoke for resale. Aba will use the profits she makes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish in large quantities to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is single and has five children. 

To earn a living, Elizabeth is a petty trader.  She sells vegetables (e.g. tomatoes, onions, garden eggs), oil, and other food items.  Elizabeth has been in this business for six years.  

She uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay for her children’s school fees.  Elizabeth will use her loan to purchase more vegetables to sell.  With the new profit, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is a married mother. Judith has been a subsistence farmer, mainly dealing in food crops. 

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main business challenges are lack of funds and water.

Judith is applying for a loan of 20,750 Kenyan shillings to buy tea tree seedlings. Her extra income will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of her family. 

She aspires to increase the area under tea tree farming.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: Susy, de 29 años es una mujer responsable, vive en compañía de su pequeño hijo y sus padres en su casa propia, donde vivió desde muy niña. Ella es una mujer muy independiente, sale adelante para el futuro de los suyos. Trabaja en una empresa consultora, de donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Más su actividad paralela es la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, se dedica desde hace muchos años, por ello tiene muchos clientes, quienes cada mes comprar los productos de belleza que oferta Susy, como es una mujer muy inteligente, siempre ofrece descuentos, pues de esa manera obtiene más clientes, quienes comprar más productos, asimismo vende lencería, ropa por catálogo. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos y poder comprar más productos de menor precio, para que en catálogos siguientes ella pueda ofrecer los descuentos, si el producto subió de costo. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los emprendedores” y este es el crédito número 17 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Susy, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de belleza para vender a sus clientes.
texts.en: Twenty-nine-year-old Susy is a responsible woman.  She lives with her young son and her parents in their home, where she has lived since she was very young.  She is a very independent woman who keeps going to ensure the future of her loved ones.  She works at a consulting business where she makes a good living.  Additionally, her side business is selling beauty products from catalogs.  She has done this for many years, but she has many customers who buy her beauty products every month.  As she is a very intelligent woman, she always offers discounts, as this wins her more customers who buy more products.  She also sells lingerie and clothing via catalog.  She currently wants to improve her income and buy more products at lower prices so that she can offer discounts if those products are more expensive in future catalogs.  She belongs to the Los Emprendedores Solidarity Group and this is her 17th loan with MFP.  She hopes for this small loan so she can achieve her objectives.  She promises to make her payments, as she did with her last loan.  She likes being part of her association because all of the members are responsible, supportive people.  Susy will use the requested money to buy beauty products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Santigie's Group

texts.en:
Meet with this group of teachers from the town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan. With the help of this loan, they will be able to buy or invest in things that their mere salaries cannot let them buy or invest in. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Santigie is the featured leader of this team. The 55 year old is a native of Kamakwie, in northern Sierra Leone, but now resides and teaches in Waterloo. He is married to a teacher and they have 3 children. 

Santigie has been a teacher for 16 years now. However, he backed his teaching profession with some petty trading. He has been selling for the past 8 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy local produce to add to his current items for sale. 

(These borrowers came in two different sets; each set was snapped separately and joined together)

loans.use: to buy local produce to add to his current items for sale.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en: Nathan lives in Kakamega County in western Kenya, and has been farming for 25 years. His wife is also a farmer, and they are currently growing sweet potatoes, maize, and bananas on their land. He enjoys beekeeping because it is easy to manage. Nathan plans to use the income from his beehives to buy even more beehives, which will earn him additional income and give him the ability to buy more food for his wife and eight children.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas lives in Kakamega county in western Kenya and has six children. She has been farming for twenty years and is currently growing maize, but hopes to one day purchase a cow. 

She likes Honey Care because of its educative training sessions, and she plans on using the income from her beehives to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement her income.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel de 57 años. Está casado con Dionisia con quien tiene 7 hijos, pero solo vive con el menor de ellos. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en un distrito agrícola. Manuel siempre muestra una sonrisa al hablar, es un hombre de buenos ánimos, se dedica a la agricultura desde los 20 años. Por eso es un hombre diestro en las labores del campo. En  la actualidad siembra papas y arvejas en sus chacras que son propias. Es consciente que el trabajo es muy cansado, por eso cuando sus hijos mayores tienen tiempo, lo apoyan con las siembras y cosechas. Está orgulloso de  ellos.
Él sabe cómo negociar sus productos. Bien en la misma ciudad de su distrito o en la ciudad de Tarma, para ello traslada sus pesados sacos con camiones. “Los compradores llevan al por mayor, por eso las ventas son más fáciles cuando se tienen conocidos”, dice. . Y como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar sus cultivos.
Éste mes es importante para la siembra de diversos productos y él no se quedará atrás. Solicita de su apoyo para adquirir bolsas de semillas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este sería su crédito número 12 con MFP, está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Razón por lo que promete pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Manuel destinará el dinero en la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas y varias bolsas de guano de ave.
texts.en:
Manuel is 57 years old.  He is married to Dionisia and they have seven children, but only the youngest lives with them.  This family lives in its own home in an agricultural region.  Manuel always smiles when he talks; he is a good-natured man who has been working in farming since he was 20 years old.  Because of this, he is skilled in fieldwork.  He currently grows potatoes and peas on his plots, which he owns.  As the work is very tiring, his older children help him with planting and harvesting when they have time.  He is proud of them.  

He knows how to sell his produce, whether in the city in his area or in the city of Tarma, where he transports his heavy sacks on trucks.  He tells us that the buyers buy wholesale, so it is easier to make sales if you know people.  Also, as he is an enterprising man, he plans to expand his crops in the future.   

This month is important for the planting of different crops and he will not be left behind.  He is asking for help to get bags of seed.  He belongs to the Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay Communal Bank and this will be his 12th loan with MFP.  He is very thankful to all of the people who made possible this loan, which will let him keep working toward progress.  He promises to make his payments on time.  Manuel will use the money to buy two bags of pea seed and several bags of bird guano.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seed and several bags of bird guano

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 46  años de edad, es un hombre  trabajador  y luchador que le gusta el trabajo, además de ser alegre y sociable. Es casado con Nelith quien es comerciante y madre de sus 02 hijas. Viven en compañía de su pareja, sus hijas y 1 nieta a quienes quiere mucho, habitan cómodamente su propia casa que  compraron con el fruto de su esfuerzo.
La actividad que realiza Juan es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de variados sabores y marcas, haciéndolas helar al gusto de sus clientes, para eso cuenta con un refrigeradora que compró con un préstamo y la instaló en su casa, desde allí  los atiende de manera amable y cordial, sabiendo que con ese trato se ganará la preferencia de sus clientes. 
Se inició con un préstamo de MFP, que le sirvió para realizar sus primeras compras, viendo la acogida que tuvo su negocio y con las ganancias que le dejaba, volvio a invertir. 
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y por el consumo constante de las bebidas gasificadas por lo caluroso de la zona.
Antes de empezar con su negocio, nos comenta que no tenía problemas, pero si el deseo de contar con un ingreso económico adicional, para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y aumentar su mercadería para ver crecer su negocio.
Este es el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP. Está agradecido con la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero, así se sentirá más seguro para avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de bebidas gasificadas de diversos sabores, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera desea obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 46 years of age, is a hard-working and determined man who likes the work, in addition to being cheerful and sociable.  He is married to Nelith who is a business woman and mother of their 2 daughters.  They live together their daughters and their spouses and one granddaughter, whom they love very much.  They live comfortably in their own home which they bought with the fruit of their effort.  

The activity that Juan performs is the sale of carbonated beverages of various flavors and brands, making them cold for the pleasure of his customers.  For this, he relies a refrigerator that he bought with a loan and installed it in his home.  From there, he attends them [the customers] in a kind and cordial manner, knowing that with this treatment he will win his customers’ preference.  

He started with a loan from MFP which allowed him to make his first purchases.  Seeing the benefit that his business had, with the earnings that he had left, he returned to invest.  

He considers his business pretty worthwhile for the profit it leaves him and for the constant consumption of carbonated beverages because of the heat in the area.  

Before starting this business, he comments that he didn’t have problems, but he did have the desire to count on an additional income to support his partner with the household expenses.  

Therefore, now seeing the good results, he has plans to continue with his business and expand his merchandise to see his business grow.

This is his fourth loan with the MFP institution.  He is grateful for the opportunity to count on financial support.  This way he will feel more secure in advancing his business.  With the requested amount of 3000 soles, he will invest all of it in the purchase of carbonated drinks of diverse flavors, looking for lower prices for his bulk purchases.  In this way, he wishes to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to buy diverse flavors of carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson lives in Kakamega county in western Kenya with his wife and six children. He is currently farming maize and bananas, and he enjoys beekeeping because of the financial returns and the medicinal properties of honey. 

This is his first loan, and he plans to use the income from his hives to build a nice house for his family. 

He has been farming for fifteen years and hopes to one day become a businessman.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement his income.

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en: Hudson lives in Kakamega County in western Kenya with his wife and seven children. He has been farming for twenty seven years, and is currently growing palm trees and sweet bananas. His wife currently works as a businesswoman. He enjoys beekeeping for two main reasons: because honey is medicinal and because he loves to eat honey. This is his first loan, and he hopes to use the income from his hives to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph lives in Kakamega County in western Kenya with his six children and his wife, who is both a farmer and a businesswoman. He likes that beekeeping is an inexpensive activity with many benefits. He plans to use the income from his hives to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward lives with his wife and three children in Kakamega, Kenya. He has been farming for five years, and is currently growing vegetables. He hopes to continue farming and wants to expand his farming activities in the future. He says he enjoys beekeeping because he loves honey, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Mirian, de 41  años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y muy dinámica, deseosa de progresar.  Es casada  con Einer  quien es docente, fruto de ésta unión tiene 2 hijos: Einer  de 15 años y Keiko de 13 años de edad respectivamente, habitando en su casa propia que compraron con esfuerzo y dedicación.
La actividad a la que de dedica Mirian es la costura y confección de  prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, actividad que aprendió desde muy joven estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, logrando aprender todo lo necesario para desempeñarse en éste oficio y ha sabido hacerse conocida ganándose algunos clientes.
Para empezar instaló su propio taller en su casa, iniciándose con una sola maquina que compró con sus ahorros, atendiendo los requerimientos de sus clientes que han ido en aumento. Realiza ésta actividad desde hace más de 05 años, y hasta el momento de desempeña sola. 
Le gusta su actividad  por contar con un ingreso económico  para solventar los gastos del hogar y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, porque a su esposo no le alcanzaba con los ingresos que tiene en su  actividad de docente,  necesitando de un ingreso económico adicional.  Desea continuar y ampliar su negocio y comprar otras maquinas de coser.
Este es el  préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, está contenta de saber que cuenta con una poyo financiero para concretar sus planes, por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el  pago de sus cuotas para tener  un buen récord crediticio.
Con  el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales  para costura como telas, hilos, elásticas, botones, etc., buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, para tener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Mirian is a hardworking, happy, dynamic woman who wants to get ahead.  She is married to Einer, who is a teacher, and they have two children, 15-year-old Einer and 13-year-old Keiker.  They live in the house they bought through hard work and dedication.

Mirian sews and makes women's, men's, and children's clothing for a living.  She learned this business when she was very young by studying at an occupational education center.  She was able to learn everything she needed to work in this field and she has been able to make a name for herself and attract some customers.

She started out by setting up her own sewing studio in her home with only one machine, which she bought with her savings, and tending to her customers' needs, which have been increasing.  She has been in this business for over five years and so far she has worked on her own.
